title: Just what IS the liquid that forms on top of a yoghurt?
text: comments Yoghurt fans will be familiar with the mildly off-putting liquid that can form at the top of a tub. But whether we tip it away, mix it into the yoghurt, or avoid the problem altogether by shaking the tub before opening, many of us have been content to remain in the dark over exactly what the watery substance is. It's actually whey - the liquid left behind when milk has been strained and curdled - which naturally separates and settles on top of yoghurt. And instead of pouring it away, we should be stirring it into the yoghurt, as the liquid contains protein. The answer has been revealed! Do you know what the liquid is that appears at the top of your yoghurt? Cooking Light says the liquid contains 'a little protein' and that is has a 'slight tart flavour', and recommends simply stirring it into the yoghurt before eating. But some people find the sight of the liquid difficult to stomach. RELATED ARTICLES
